comments:
After compiling my C++ project, i started the compiled application with the
"Run" button in eclipse ( 2.1 final release ). Then an error message box occured
with the following content: "Exception occured during launch" "Reason: Error
within Debug UI".
Nevertheless, the aplication launches, so that's not the main problem. The bad
thing is if i choose to debug the application i get the same Error Message and
when i want to debug my Source, eclipse doesn't step through my Source code. I
can set a break point and the application stops at the break point. But if i
want to walk step by step throug my Source code, the blue arrow in the source
window stays at the breakpoint and doesnet move. This is both i click on "step
over" and "step into". In the Debug window, where you can see the threads,
eclipse shows in which line number and in which source file the debugger is. So
it seems to be a problem of the window which shows the sources.

Here is some Information about my System:
I'm using Suse Linux 7.3
kernel version 2.4.20
1 GHz Athlon with 1 GB RAM

For my Eclipse Installation, i installed the following files:

eclipse-SDK-2.1-linux-gtk.zip
org.eclipse.cdt-200303270414-linux-gtk_1.0.1.src.zip
org.eclipse.cdt-linux-gtk_1.0.1.bin.dist.zip
atk-1.2.0.tar.bz2
pango-1.0.5.tar.bz2
pango-1.2.1.tar.bz2
glib-2.2.1.tar.bz2
gtk+-2.2.1.tar.bz2
gtk+-2.2.1 patch, see Bug #35872 for more information
pkgconfig-0.14.0.tar.gz
tiff-v3.5.7.tar.gz
jpegsrc.v6b.tar.gz
libpng-1.2.5.tar.gz
j2sdk-1_4_1_01-linux-i586-rpm.bin
j2sdk-1_4_1-doc.zip
gdb-5.3.tar.gz

Ok, that's it.
For further Information, please ask me.

Good Luck finding the error.
Vasudeva

Do you have mutual references in your project? 
The stack overflow bug was fixed on March 14, 2003 in CDT 1.0.1 branch.

Answer to Comment #1

Mikhail,

thank you very much, this was the problem. I think this was my error.
I set the reference from one project to annother while the same project
references already to this this one. After i put back this step, it works fine
again.
